key_points: At least four people were injured in a school shooting at Timberview High School in Arlington, Texas.
The suspect, identified as Timothy George Simpkins, is in custody and faces three counts of aggravated assault with a deadly weapon.
The shooting occurred after a physical altercation in a classroom on the second floor.
Two victims were shot, and three were hospitalized; all are expected to survive.
A 15-year-old boy is in critical condition, and a 25-year-old man is in good condition, while a teenage girl was treated for an abrasion and released.
Simpkins turned himself in without incident and was released on a bond of $75,000.
Police recovered a .45-caliber handgun in Grand Prairie, believed to be the weapon used in the shooting, pending ballistics testing.
The shooting was described as not a random act of violence but as a result of a dispute.
Students were evacuated to a reunification center after security sweeps of the school.
Simpkins' family is asking for forgiveness, stating the action was not justified but was in self-defense.
